lyrics_features.cleaned_text: It's poetry in motion She turned her tender eyes to me As deep as any ocean As sweet as any harmony Mm, but she blinded me with science "She blinded me with science!" And failed me in biology When I'm dancing close to her "Blinding me with science, science!" I can smell the chemicals "Blinding me with science, science!" "Science!" "Science!" Mm, but it's poetry in motion And when she turned her eyes to me As deep as any ocean As sweet as any harmony Mm, but she blinded me with science And failed me in geometry When she's dancing next to me "Blinding me with science, science!" "Science!" I can hear machinery "Blinding me with science, science!" "Science!" It's poetry in motion And now she's making love to me The spheres're in commotion The elements in harmony She blinded me with science "She blinded me with science!" And hit me with technology "Good heavens Miss Sakamoto, you're beautiful!" I I don't believe it! There she goes again! She's tidied up, and I can't find anything! All my tubes and wires And careful notes And antiquated notions But! It's poetry in motion And when she turned her eyes to me As deep as any ocean As sweet as any harmony Mm, but she blinded me with science "She blinded me with, with science!" She blinded me with
